# isAuthenticationRequired

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether the user must unlock the device before the action is performed.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isAuthenticationRequired: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is ignored and treated as a value of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] when the value of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserNotificationAction/activationMode] property is set to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserNotificationActivationMode/foreground].

If your app uses data protection to encrypt data on disk, consider the data needs of the corresponding action before setting this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. For many data protection classes, data remains encrypted and unavailable while the device is locked. If your app needs to access encrypted data to perform a task, you likely need to set this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] to ensure that the data is accessible.

## Getting the action’s configuration

- **activationMode**: The mode in which to run the app when the action is performed.
- **isDestructive**: A Boolean value indicating whether the action is destructive.
- **behavior**: The custom behavior (if any) that the action supports.
- **parameters**: A dictionary of additional parameters to include with the action.
